messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Cryptic Creek Conundrum DATE: 01/01/01 The courtroom echoed with analytical debate as the trial carried on. The defense introduced the officers integral to the investigation to elaborate on their findings. LAW ENFORCEMENT TESTIMONY: DEFENSE ATTORNEY: Please state your name and role in the investigation. WITNESS: I am Captain A. B. Allen, the key investigator in this case. DEFENSE ATTORNEY: Thank you, Captain Allen. Can you elaborate on the events on the day the conundrum was found? WITNESS: Sure. On the morning of February 2nd, Officer C. D. Davis detected a cryptic situation at the Creek area and informed the department. The investigation was launched swiftly. DEFENSE ATTORNEY: Who oversaw the evidence analysis? WITNESS: Sergeant E. F. Evans and Technician G. H. Harris were responsible for analyzing the evidence gathered. DEFENSE ATTORNEY: Who directed the interrogations? WITNESS: Detective I. J. Jackson and Detective K. L. King led the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses. DEFENSE ATTORNEY: Thank you. No further questions. The Prosecution proceeded with a detailed cross-examination of Captain Allen regarding the investigative practices. Throughout the trial, Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson, Patrol Officer O. P. Owens, and Patrol Officer Q. R. Rogers were also called to testify.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Captain A. B. Allen 
Officer Context: Captain Allen is the key investigator in the Cryptic Creek Conundrum case, elaborating on the events on the day the conundrum was found during the trial. 
Officer Role: Captain 

Officer Name: Officer C. D. Davis 
Officer Context: Officer Davis detected a cryptic situation at the Creek area on the morning of February 2nd, which initiated the investigation. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Sergeant E. F. Evans 
Officer Context: Sergeant Evans, along with Technician G. H. Harris, oversaw the analysis of the evidence collected related to the case. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician G. H. Harris 
Officer Context: Technician Harris worked with Sergeant E. F. Evans on analyzing the evidence concerning the cryptic situation at the Creek area. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective I. J. Jackson 
Officer Context: Detective Jackson, alongside Detective K. L. King, directed the interrogations of suspects and potential witnesses to gather more information regarding the conundrum. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Detective K. L. King 
Officer Context: Detective King, along with Detective I. J. Jackson, led the interrogations to collect additional information about the incident. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer M. N. Nelson 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Nelson was called to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer O. P. Owens 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Owens was also summoned to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer 

Officer Name: Patrol Officer Q. R. Rogers 
Officer Context: Patrol Officer Rogers was brought to testify during the trial, although their specific role in the investigation was not detailed in the transcript. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officer
